intro: Antimima pauper, commonly known as the poor antimima, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its succulent and often ornamental species. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow or white, blooming during the cooler months. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native dry environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Antimima pauper is considered a vulnerable species.
